taxonFacts: Known for their vibrant colors and elaborate courtship dances.
Males perform intricate displays to attract females.
Found primarily in Australia and New Guinea.
Small jumping spiders with distinctive patterns.
Some species mimic ants to avoid predators.
Includes bats known for their nose-leaf structures.
Use echolocation to navigate and hunt insects.
Found in diverse habitats across the world.
Commonly known as sea butterflies, they are pelagic snails.
Use wing-like structures for swimming in the ocean.
Play a role in marine food webs as prey.
Includes bats with diverse diets, from insects to fruit.
Some species can live over 30 years.
